entry.title: In the calm of flames
entry.summary:
Author: ShyHeroWrites

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,068Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: During a grueling 48-hour shift, exhausted firefighter Buck stubbornly refuses to admit his fatigue. His best friend, Eddie, intervenes, gently forcing Buck into the bunkroom and lying with him to provide comfort and help him sleep. Their 118 teammates, Bobby, Hen, and Chimney, find the scene endearing and quietly support Eddie's efforts. While Buck rests, Eddie and the others discuss planning a team outing to help him de-stress. Buck wakes up, touched by their concern, and acknowledges his need to lean on them. When an alarm sounds, the team springs into action, successfully handling the call. Returning to the firehouse, Buck feels immense gratitude for his found family and the unwavering support that makes them unbreakable.

entry.title: Phoenix from the ashes
entry.summary:
Author: Ficalicious

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,261Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 239

Summary: All in all, Buck was feeling great about his return to the 118.He had earned his life back.Spencer had been right, the decision to take his leg had been the right one in the end he knew, he had no regrets. And the team had welcomed him back, Bobby especially despite the fact that during the first few shifts the man had looked more than a little tense, his eyes constantly straying back to Buck as if he was terrified something would go wrong and he’d get hurt again....Buck is back where he belongs. Featuring surprise visitors, and LA having a new serial killer calling himself the Phoenix.

entry.title: Tangled Between Grief and Love
entry.summary:
Author: the_writers_block15

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,010Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 8

Summary: While Eddie’s on shift, Buck takes Christopher out to celebrate what would’ve been Shannon’s 33rd birthday. Along the way, new truths about grief and love begin to surface as Buck helps Christopher navigate the weight of missing and losing his mother. Meanwhile, Eddie has a reckoning of his own when the day’s events come to light.Content note: The first part of this story deals closely with grief. If you’re not in a place to read that right now, please take care of yourself and skip this one — no hard feelings.

entry.title: just a little bit of your heart (is all I'm asking for)
entry.summary:
Author: dbolterstar

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 193,362Chapters: 21/40Kudos: 200

Summary: “Does this change a thing between us?” Buck asks, his voice low, his hands still framing Eddie’s face. He can feel the unsteady breaths leaving Eddie’s lips, warm against his own. Eddie looks wrecked. His cheeks are flushed, lips red and kiss-swollen, his glassy eyes locked on Buck’s mouth like it’s the only thing he can see. He looks as hungry as Buck feels. Buck feels Eddie’s fingers trace along his arms, squeezing just enough to leave his skin tingling. “I don’t know.” It’s not a yes—Buck’s not even sure he wants to hear a yes. But it’s so much better than the rejection Eddie threw at him before. “Alright,” Buck exhales, nodding like it’s nothing, even though it feels massive. Then he surges forward, catching Eddie’s mouth in his again. The soft, desperate sound Eddie lets out—like relief and need tangled together—hits Buck like a punch to the chest. or; Eddie’s shame torments him. Buck would rather have a piece of Eddie than nothing at all. Miscommunication is their biggest enemy. Infidelity turns into their savior… or ends up being the thing that destroys them?

entry.title: This Is How It Ends (Every Time)
entry.summary:
Author: Silveraura

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,049Chapters: 2/5Kudos: 7

Summary: Buck loves him like a bruise that never fades. It sits under the surface and aches whenever he breathes too close.Eddie lives behind walls he cannot name, too afraid of what might happen if he lets the truth in and the denial out.One night, Buck speaks the words Eddie has spent years avoiding. The air does not ignite, but something shifts. Something cracks.Now they are standing in the ruins of what they never had the courage to build.They are not lovers.They are not only friends.They are something unbearable in between.

entry.title: Eddies, Twists, and Turns
entry.summary:
Author: Lance_Spears

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,328Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 10

Summary: Things between Eddie and Buck have been... weird, ever since he got back from Texas. Eddie tries to find out why, and in doing so uncovers buried secrets about his sexuality and the Buck-Tommy relationship. In other words, it’s a word-vomit on what I would like the Buddie arc to be like.-“You’re an Eddie.”Eddie scrunched his forehead. “Huh?”“No, an eddy. A smaller current that runs opposite to the prevailing current.”Eddie stayed silent. What was happening here? This was all so strange, surreal. But Buck was talking again and there was no time for wondering.“All your life, the winds have been blowing you one way, but you’ve always been fighting against them. This whole time. You never gave up. You kept trying.”“What are you talking about, Buck?”Buck gave no immediate answer. He just stared at Eddie. Eddie blinked several times rapidly. Buck barely blinked at all. Buck’s breaths had shallowed and quieted. His mouth was red and smiling. His birthmark blazed red against his soft, tan skin. His gaze had narrowed, and there was some inscrutable quality to his eyes, those eyes that were looking at Eddie like he was the only thing in the world.
